intro: Epidendrum borealistachyum, commonly known as the Boreal Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to northern regions of North America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. The plant features a sympodial growth habit, with rhizomes that produce new shoots at the base. Its leaves are usually broad and lance-shaped, and it produces clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. This orchid is adapted to cool climates and is often found in association with other boreal flora.
